text: A C / EBP , CRE and Two AP-1 Sites in the Murine <extra_id_0> SerpinB2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> Gene Proximal Promoter are Essential for Optimal LPS - inducible Transcription

To investigate regulatory elements between -539 and -189 essential for LPS - inducible transcription , several candidate binding sites for transcription factors previously reported to mediate LPS - inducible transcription in other genes [ 57 ] were targeted by nucleotide substitution designed to disrupt transcription factor binding to the pGLmP-539 murine <extra_id_0> SerpinB2 promoter-luciferase reporter gene <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> construct ( Fig . 4A ) .
As shown in Fig . 4B , mutation of the consensus E box ( -538 / -533 ) , PU.1 ( -412 / -407 ) , or the variant Oct-1 ( -296 / -288 ) site did not decrease LPS - induced promoter activity .

In contrast , mutation of the C / EBP site ( -203 / -192 ) completely eliminated promoter activity , similar to the levels observed for the -189 <extra_id_0> SerpinB2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> promoter deletion construct .
Others have also recently implicated this C / EBP site in LPS - induced activation of the <extra_id_0> SerpinB2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> gene [ 58 ] .

Considering the conserved sequence and position of the CRE and two AP-1 sites in the murine <extra_id_0> SerpinB2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> promoter and their demonstrated involvement in the PMA-responsiveness of the human <extra_id_0> SERPINB2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> promoter [ 37 ] , these sites were also mutated by nucleotide substitution to investigate whether they played a role in the LPS response of the murine <extra_id_0> SerpinB2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> promoter .

As shown in Fig . 4B , mutation of the CRE at -177 / -172 or either of the two AP-1 sites at -106 / -100 and -94 / -88 , completely or significantly reduced LPS - inducible <extra_id_0> luciferase <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> activity from the murine <extra_id_0> SerpinB2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> promoter .

These data show that the C / EBP element , as well as the CRE and both AP-1 cis - acting elements are critical for LPS - inducible transcription from the <extra_id_0> SerpinB2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> proximal promoter .
